other_tests.findings: Sinus tachycardia at a rate of 102, PR interval of 220 msec, a single ventricular premature beat, and a possible anteroseptal infarct of uncertain age.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Subsequent electrocardiograms showed a PR interval of 300 msec and complete atrioventricular block, with a heart rate of 35 and wide ventricular complexes.

other_tests.findings: Clear, colorless cerebrospinal fluid containing 1 red cell and 3 white cells per cubic millimeter, with the total protein level of 23 mg per deciliter and glucose level of 129 mg per deciliter.
An injection of vancomycin and ceftazidime was performed into the left eye.
Thickening of the aortic-valve leaflets and mobile material attached to the leaflets, consistent with vegetation; suspected aortic-root abscess.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Later, a transesophageal echocardiogram confirmed thickening of the aortic-valve leaflets and the presence of abscess material.

other_tests.findings: Thickening of the aortic-valve leaflets and mobile vegetative material; destruction of the noncoronary cusp and a fistula connecting the noncoronary sinus to the right atrium.
